body_html:
I believe I'm also running into this error. Here's the end of the traceback:

RuntimeError: MAGMA gesdd : the updating process of SBDSDC did not converge (error: 8) at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1503965122592/work/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu:325

Turns out my matrices are badly conditioned – I had numbers on the order of 1e38. Fixing this resolved the problem.

Note I see "(error: 8)" not "(error: 1)" as above. Looking at sbdsdc.f, I see that the number is described as

INFO (output) INTEGER
= 0: successful exit.
< 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.
> 0: The algorithm failed to compute an singular value.
The update process of divide and conquer failed.

body:
I believe I'm also running into this error. Here's the end of the traceback:

> RuntimeError: MAGMA gesdd : the updating process of SBDSDC did not converge (error: 8) at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1503965122592/work/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu:325


Turns out my matrices are badly conditioned – I had numbers on the order of 1e38. Fixing this resolved the problem.


Note I see "(error: 8)" not "(error: 1)" as above. Looking at [sbdsdc.f], I see that the number is described as 

> INFO    (output) INTEGER
         = 0:  successful exit.
         < 0:  if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.
         > 0:  The algorithm failed to compute an singular value.
               The update process of divide and conquer failed.

[sgesdd.f]:http://www.netlib.org/lapack/lapack-3.1.1/html/sgesdd.f.html
[sbdsdc.f]:http://www.netlib.org/lapack/lapack-3.1.1/html/sbdsdc.f.html#SBDSDC.1
